word: She was an indefatigable worker. She preached when she was sick and hoarse with a bad cold (Letter 37, 1876); She preached while suffering with a "most distressing headache" (Letter 30, 1876); She preached at five o' clock in the morning and in the middle of a disagreeably hot afternoon (ST, July 13, 1876), p 236). In describing one of her meetings in Maine, she states:
